intro: Lacmellea aculeata var. surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, milky sap and striking, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in complex inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a houseplant or in botanical gardens.
